vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/b3eed93f-1f0e-443f-8a03-d3141be7db71">WOOD</keyword>         <topcClas>Energy and fuel - Environment, conservation and land use</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The International Energy Agency (IEA) datasets published by the Energy Statistics Division (ESD) contain annual and quarterly time series data from 1960 onwards on energy production, trade, stocks, transformation, consumption, prices and taxes as well as on greenhouse gas emissions for over the 30 Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Member countries and over 100 non-OECD countries worldwide.<br> <br> In OECD Member countries the data are collected by official bodies (most often the national statistics office in each country) from firms, government agencies and industry organisations and are then reported to the IEA using questionnaires to ensure international comparability. In non-OECD countries the data are collected directly from government and industry contacts and from national publications.<br> <br> <b>Energy Balances of OECD Countries:</b><br> This database contains energy balances for 30 OECD countries and six regions. Detailed energy balances are provided in kJ/kg and toe/t. Definitions of products and flows, explanatory notes on the individual country data, indicators (including GDP, population, industrial production index and ratios calculated with the energy data) and net calorific values are also included. In general, data are available from 1960. This database is updated by the IEA in May each year.<br> <br> This database was first made available by the UK Data Service in June 2005 and is updated annually. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its IEA Energy Balances of OECD Countries database, including a <a href=" http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/iea.aspx" title="IEA Energy Balances of OECD Countries dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/iea/ebo/2011" title="IEA Energy Balances of OECD Countries database">latest database updates</a>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: International Energy Agency (<i>{YYYY}</i>): Energy Balances of OECD Countries Database (<i>{Ed. YYYY}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/iea/ebo/2011">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/iea/ebo/2011</a>}</i>. <br> <br> <b>Alternative DOIs:</b> <a href="http://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/energy/data/iea-world-energy-statistics-and-balances_enestats-data-en" title="10.1787/enestats-data-en">10.1787/enestats-data-en</a> (to access via OECD.Stat subscription).<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered include:<ul><li>energy balances in kJ/kg and toe/t</li><li>coal and coal products</li><li>peat</li><li>crude, NGL (natural gas liquids) and feedstocks</li><li>petroleum products</li><li>natural gas</li><li>nuclear</li><li>hydro</li><li>geothermal</li><li>solar/wind/other</li><li>combustible renewables and waste</li><li>electricity</li><li>heat</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The IEA Energy Balances of OECD Countries database runs from 1960 onwards and is updated annually.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Data are included for 30 OECD Member countries:<br/>Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, United Kingdom, United States</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>annual</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See the <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/iea.aspx" title="IEA dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> for information on sampling methodology.</sampProc>         <collMode>See the <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/iea.aspx" title="IEA dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> for further information on methodology.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Restricted access</specPerm>         <restrctn>Registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. Additional special conditions of use also apply. See <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions/specialconditions.aspx'>terms and conditions</a> for further information.<br/><br/> Available to those registered at UK institutions of higher or further education only.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>
